trans-unit.source: Opens or closes the CD tray.

seg-source.mrk: Opens or closes the CD tray.

target.mrk: Opens or closes the CD tray.

trans-unit.source: The drive letter of the CD tray to control, in the format D:, E:, etc.

seg-source.mrk: The drive letter of the CD tray to control, in the format D:,

target.mrk: The drive letter of the CD tray to control, in the format D:,

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the CD tray to be open or closed:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies if you want the CD tray to be open or closed:

target.mrk: Specifies if you want the CD tray to be open or closed:

trans-unit.source: $CDTRAY_CLOSED ("closed") - to be closed on cd tray (not laptop-style)

seg-source.mrk: $CDTRAY_CLOSED ("closed") - to be closed on cd tray (not laptop-style)

target.mrk: $CDTRAY_CLOSED ("closed") - to be closed on cd tray (not laptop-style)

trans-unit.source: 0 if drive is locked via CD burning software or if the drive letter is not a CD drive.

seg-source.mrk: 0 if drive is locked via CD burning software or if the drive letter is not a CD drive.

target.mrk: 0 if drive is locked via CD burning software or if the drive letter is not a CD drive.

trans-unit.source: CDTray() works as expected with virtual CD drives such as DAEMON Tools.

seg-source.mrk: CDTray() works as expected with virtual CD drives such as DAEMON Tools.

target.mrk: CDTray() works as expected with virtual CD drives such as DAEMON Tools.

trans-unit.source: CDTray() does not work on non-local/mapped CD drives; CDTray() must be run from the computer whose drive it affects.

seg-source.mrk: CDTray() does not work on non-local/mapped CD drives; CDTray() must be run from the computer whose drive it affects.

target.mrk: CDTray() does not work on non-local/mapped CD drives; CDTray() must be run from the computer whose drive it affects.

trans-unit.source: CDTray("X:", "close") returns 1 on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.

seg-source.mrk: "close") returns 1 on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.

target.mrk: "close") returns 1 on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.

trans-unit.source: Open the CD tray of the first CDRom

seg-source.mrk: Open the CD tray of the first CDRom

target.mrk: Open the CD tray of the first CDRom

trans-unit.source: does not work on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.

seg-source.mrk: does not work on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.

target.mrk: does not work on laptop-style cd trays that can only be closed manually.
